extendedIngredients.name: garlic
extendedIngredients.original: 4 cloves garlic, crushed or to taste

extendedIngredients.name: tomato
extendedIngredients.original: 1 cup peeled, seeded, and diced tomato

title: Garlic and Tomato Tilapia
summary: Garlic and Tomato Tilapia requires about 30 minutes from start to finish. This recipe serves 2 and costs $3.57 per serving. One serving contains 243 calories, 36g of protein, and 9g of fat. 1 person were impressed by this recipe. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free, primal, and pescatarian diet. If you have tilapia, salt and pepper, tomato, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the sour cream you could follow this main course with the Sour Cream Apple Pie as a dessert. It works well as a main course. It is brought to you by Allrecipes. Overall, this recipe earns a good spoonacular score of 77%. Try Broiled Tilapia With Garlic, Lemon Garlic Tilapia, and Garlic Alfredo Tilapia for similar recipes.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).                            In a medium bowl, mash together the garlic and tomato. Stir in the sour cream and season with salt and pepper.  Place the fish fillets in a shallow baking dish.                            Bake fish for 10 minutes in the preheated oven, until about halfway done. Remove from the oven, and pour the tomato sauce over it. Return to the oven, and cook for 10 more minutes, or until fish flakes easily with a fork.                                                Kitchen-Friendly View

steps.step: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
In a medium bowl, mash together the garlic and tomato. Stir in the sour cream and season with salt and pepper.
Place the fish fillets in a shallow baking dish.
Bake fish for 10 minutes in the preheated oven, until about halfway done.
Remove from the oven, and pour the tomato sauce over it. Return to the oven, and cook for 10 more minutes, or until fish flakes easily with a fork.
